U2 to receive Innovator Award

Legendary band U2 will be honoured with the Innovator Award on April 3 at this year’s iHeartRadio Music Awards.

The rockers will be feted for their impact on popular culture and commitment to social causes, reported Billboard magazine. “U2 is a band of activists, not only in music but in politics, popular culture and human rights,” President of entertainment enterprises for iHeartMedia John Sykes said. “They began as a punk band and that attitude still runs strong throughout their songwriting, albums and live performances. They will never stop testing the limits, and that’s why we are honoured to recognize them with this Innovator Award.” The honour, which will be given to Bono and his bandmates during the awards show in Los Angeles on April 3, comes as the group is celebrating its 40th anniversary. — PTI
